name: Thenatureofcode
body:
## [Assignment 1: Random Walker](http://cybermarinella.github.io/theNatureofCode/Kadenze01-RandomWalker/) 100%
**Create your own object that moves around the screen. What is it? A butterfly? An alien? Be as creative as you like.**
In this session we’ll review the basics of p5.js and get everyone up and running with posting sketches online. We’ll look at how object-oriented programming works in JS and create simple sketches of objects moving around a canvas.

##  [Assignment 2: Physics](http://cybermarinella.github.io/theNatureofCode/Assignment2-Physics/) 110%
**Create a simulation entirely driven by forces.**
This session will look at the concept of a vector and implement sketches using a p5.Vector object. By creating objects with vectors for position, velocity, and acceleration, we’ll build a simple “hello world” physics engine.

## Assignment 3: Steering Forces
This assignment will have you creating your own simulation using steering forces.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
